intro: Amyema articulata, commonly known as the articulated amyema, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, opposite leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale pink, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. Amyema articulata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks.
